organization.fullName: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Circulating circRNA in Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Clinical Significance of Circulating circRNA in Acute Ischemic Stroke (CRAST)

leadSponsor.name: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: CRAST is to analyze the expression pattern of circular RNA (circRNA) by bioinformatics analysis in patients with acute ischemic stroke and healthy control. The candidate circRNA will be verified as biomarkers for the detection and prognosis of acute ischemic stroke.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Circular RNAs have been highlighted to be involved in the pathological process of ischemic stroke (IS). The purpose of this protocol will investigate the expression pattern of circular RNA (circRNA) by bioinformatics analysis in patients with acute ischemic stroke and healthy control. The candidate circRNA will be verified as biomarkers for the detection and prognosis of acute ischemic stroke. Distinctive expression patterns of circRNA will be identified by individual quantitative real time polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR). A diagnostic or predictive model will be established using logistic regression. The panel of these altered circRNAs may be associated with acute IS and could serve as a novel diagnostic or predictive method.

bioSpec.description: An 10 ml peripheral venous blood will be collected from the participants before and after interventions (i.e. intravenous thrombolysis and/or endovascular therapy)

armGroups.label: AIS group
armGroups.description: This group includes patients with acute ischemic stroke (AIS).
interventionNames: Genetic: Quantitative Real-time polymerase chain reaction

armGroups.label: HC group
interventionNames: Genetic: Quantitative Real-time polymerase chain reaction

interventions.name: Quantitative Real-time polymerase chain reaction
interventions.description: Quantitative Real-time polymerase chain reaction of circular RNA (circRNA).

primaryOutcomes.description: Differential expression pattern of circular RNA (circRNA) will be compared between AIS group and HC group, thus candidate circRNA will be verified as biomarkers for the detection and prognosis of AIS.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dynamic changes of circRNA during the follow-up period
secondaryOutcomes.description: Dynamic changes of circRNA will be explored before and after endovascular therapy

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation of circRNA and stroke-associated infection
secondaryOutcomes.description: Correlation of circRNA and stroke-associated infection will be explored in acute ischemic stroke.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation of circRNA and inflammatory factors in acute ischemic stroke
secondaryOutcomes.description: Correlation of circRNA and inflammatory factors on admission will be explored in acute ischemic stroke.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Prognostic value of circRNA in acute ischemic stroke
secondaryOutcomes.description: The prognosis of AIS patients will be analyzed between differential expressed candidate circRNA after they have completed the systematic therapy.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Aged 18 years or older
* Confirmed acute ischemic stroke by a diffusion-weighted imaging-position lesion on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and a new lesion on a brain computed tomography (CT) scan
* Within 72 hours of symptom onset
* Good performance status
* Signed an approved informed consents

Exclusion Criteria:

* a history of hemorrhagic infarction, chronic kidney/liver diseases, peripheral arterial occlusive disease, active malignant disease, and inflammatory or infectious diseases
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: There will be 100 patients suspected of AIS (such as transient ischemic attack), 300 AIS patients and 100 Healthy controlsï¼Œwhose data will be applied for construction and validation of diagnostic and predictive models of circRNA from the circulating blood.
